```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)
```



Call library and data

```{r}
packages = c("tidyverse")

for (p in packages) {
  if(!require(p, character.only = T)) {
    install.packages(p)
  }
  library(p, character.only = T)
}

participants <- read_csv("data/Participants.csv")

```

Household Size vs Kids

```{r}
ggplot(data=participants, aes(x=householdSize, fill = haveKids)) +
  geom_bar() +
  theme_minimal()
```

Age vs Education Level

```{r}
ggplot(data=participants, aes(y=educationLevel, x=age)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  stat_summary(geom = "point",
               fun="mean",
               colour="red",
               size=4) +
  theme_minimal()
```

Age vs Kids Histogram

```{r}
p <- participants[,-3]

ggplot(participants, aes(x= age, fill = haveKids)) +
  geom_histogram(data=p, fill = "grey",
                 alpha = .5, bins = 20) +
  geom_histogram(colour = "black", bins=20) +
  facet_wrap(~ haveKids) +
  guides(fill = "none") +
  theme_minimal()
```

Joviality vs Kids boxplot

```{r}
ggplot(data=participants, aes(y=haveKids, x=joviality)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  stat_summary(geom = "point",
               fun="mean",
               colour="red",
               size=4) +
  coord_flip() +
  ylab("Have Kids") +
  xlab("Joviality") +
  theme_minimal()
```

Joviality vs Activity

```{r}
ggplot(data=participants, aes(x= reorder(interestGroup, joviality, FUN =median), 
                              y=joviality)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  stat_summary(geom = "point",
               fun="mean",
               colour="red",
               size=4) +
  xlab("Interest Group") +
  ylab("Joviality") +
  theme_minimal()
```

Activity Favoured by Those with and without Kids (Stacked %)

```{r}
ggplot(participants, aes(fill=haveKids, x=interestGroup)) + 
    geom_bar(position="fill") +
  theme_minimal()
```

Activity Favoured by Those with and without Kids (Stacked Count)

```{r}
ggplot(data=participants, aes(x=interestGroup, fill = haveKids)) +
  geom_bar() +
  theme_minimal()
```
